circumstances:
The aircraft left RAF Leeming in the morning on a bombing mission to Wilhelmshaven. While overflying The Netherlands, the aircraft was shot down by the pilot of a German fighter, dove into the ground and crashed in an open field located in Driezum. Four crew members were killed while the fifth occupant was seriously injured.
Crew (77th Squadron):
S/L Leslie E. W. Parkin, pilot, †
Sgt Douglas J. Sandlin, pilot, †
Sgt Robert C. S. Hancock, radio navigator,
Sgt Edmund S. Ayton, air gunner, †
Sgt Wilfred Whittam, wireless operator. †
probable_cause: Shot down by a German fighter.
